title: Chelsea vow to fight Manchester United in race for £86m Atletico Madrid striker Antoine Griezmann
text:
MANN OF WAR Chelsea vow to fight Manchester United in race for £86m Atletico Madrid striker Antoine Griezmann 
Blues boss Antonio Conte sees the Frenchman as the perfect boost to his frontline while Jose Mourinho is a long-term fan Exclusive 24th March 2017, 9:52 pm Updated: 24th March 2017, 10:24 pm Comments CHELSEA will go to war with Manchester United to sign Antoine Griezmann. 
SunSport can reveal the Premier League leaders have registered an interest in buying the £86million-rated Atletico Madrid striker. Reuters Atletico and France striker Griezmann is wanted by both Chelsea and Man Utd 
Blues boss Antonio Conte sees the France ace as the perfect player to strengthen his front-line. 
SEE HOW CHELSEA WILL LINE UP WITH ANTOINE GRIEZMANN IN THEIR TEAM 
Griezmann has been a long term target for United and Jose Mourinho believes his side are ahead of his former club in the negotiations. 
Griezmann’s buy-out clause is £86m — any bid of that size means he is free to discuss personal terms this summer. 
Conte is determined the Blues will not be beaten and will match any United offer. 
The Italian has been given a blank cheque-book to improve his squad for next season. Getty Images Griezmann seems set for a move to the Prem but is likely to cost around £86million Getty Images 5 Ex-Real Sociedad hitman Griezmann has long been the No 1 target for Manchester United and now he has shot up the wishlist of Chelsea manager Antonio Conte 
Conte knows his team will have to go up another level again — as they compete in the Champions League as well as for domestic honours. Chelsea have powered ten points clear of the Prem pack but expect to sell at least three players in the close season in order to make room to strengthen their first XI.
